result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfonso J Garza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alfonso J Garza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alfonso J Garza was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $ TBD    plus surcharges.  Restitution Hearing to be scheduled.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Alfonso J Garza, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.   As a condition court imposes 30 days in the KCJ commencing on 5/21/16 @ 8:00 a.m. Sentence is concurrent to 15CF1026.  Restitution to be determined through a restitution hearing before Commissioner Dowse. Court costs ordered.  Cash bond on deposit to be applied to costs and restitution.  Any unpaid court costs that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning, and Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing hearing on May 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm confirmed with Atty Koesser
Due to a continued jury trial; Sentencing rescheduled to 5/4/16 at 2:00 PM pending confirmation from Atty Koesser

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Hans Koesser.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 4/13/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.
